statsguruLinks.title: Top strike rates for SA bowlers in last 12 months
SL bowlers v SA in last five years

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Duminy 86 (90b 9x4 0x6 136m) SR: 95.55

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan's out bowled but somehow he's not convinced, Duminy was bowling from round the wicket, Dilshan was looking to sweep, the ball struck the off bail, Dilshan didn't really see how he was bowled and hung around for a few seconds, the ball deflected off the glove to the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Imran Tahir 48 (70b 1x4 0x6 88m) SR: 68.57

dismissalComment.html: tossed up and Jayawardene had made room to scoop it over the off side but he didn't read the googly and the ball crashed middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: that was more a Test match dismissal, McLaren bowled it on the corridor of uncertainty, Mathews was cramped for room, feet not moving and thick outside edge to the keeper, the sort of dismissal on the first morning of a Test with the new ball
Kulasekara stayed at the crease and looked to smash it just about anywhere, nowhere near the pitch of it and he got a top edge that swirled to the off side, de Villiers takes the skier

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the third for the over! This was the short ball and slower as well, Priyanjan had crossed the previous ball and took strike but he too fell to a top edge, swung too early and an easy one for AB running forward from mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the short one was too good for Mendis, Mendis was down the track and he hung out the periscope after realising that he couldn't hook it, feathers the edge and de Kock appeals

Tahir gets away with a short one and Thirimanne had only himself to blame here, it was asking to be hit over the on side but the batsman got the placement all wrong, Amla was at deep midwicket and he didn't have to move much, bends and takes it comfortably
tossed up and Jayawardene had made room to scoop it over the off side but he didn't read the googly and the ball crashed middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Amla b Philander 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: that was a very soft dismissal! This was drifting on the pads and Kusal shuffled and looked to tuck it to the on side, too early on the shot and the ball lobbed tamely to short midwicket, you could have caught that with your eyes shut

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c de Kock b Morkel 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: caught down the leg side and that's the big wicket, Morkel dug it in short down the leg side and Sangakkara was looking to pull, the ball got high on him and the ball brushed his glove first, he walked

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Amla b Imran Tahir 36 (49b 4x4 0x6 56m) SR: 73.46

dismissalComment.html: Tahir gets away with a short one and Thirimanne had only himself to blame here, it was asking to be hit over the on side but the batsman got the placement all wrong, Amla was at deep midwicket and he didn't have to move much, bends and takes it comfortably

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c de Kock b McLaren 2 (6b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: the short one was too good for Mendis, Mendis was down the track and he hung out the periscope after realising that he couldn't hook it, feathers the edge and de Kock appeals

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c Morkel b Philander 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: So Sri Lanka don't last 50 overs after all, this was a fuller delivery and Malinga was looking to clear the rope down the ground, he picked long-on and SL have lost 5 wickets for 11 runs

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Senanayake b Malinga 101 (102b 11x4 0x6 162m) SR: 99.01

dismissalComment.html: it's a full toss and Amla has holed out! On the body and he looks to swing it over the infield but a very easy catch for Senanayake at midwicket, they check if the ball was above waist height but it was within the limit

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c sub (NLTC Perera) b Dilshan 29 (41b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 70.73

dismissalComment.html: huge relief for Sri Lanka as AB finds long-on with precision, it was flighted and AB was down the track but didn't loft with conviction, he feared the worst as soon as he hit it, Thisara takes it well in front of the rope

he comes round the wicket and the ploy works straightaway! Bowled from slightly wide of the crease and he got it to angle back in sharply and de Kock was playing down the wrong line, hits the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's another failure for Kallis! The sharp bouncer leads to his downfall, Malinga reverts to over the wicket for Kallis, bangs it in short and Kallis can't resist the hook, there was a sound and Sangakkara threw the ball up as soon as he caught it, it was a good catch too

it's a full toss and Amla has holed out! On the body and he looks to swing it over the infield but a very easy catch for Senanayake at midwicket, they check if the ball was above waist height but it was within the limit
another yorker but this time Morkel couldn't keep it out, it was in fact the slower ball, Morkel played all around it and the ball struck the off stump

huge relief for Sri Lanka as AB finds long-on with precision, it was flighted and AB was down the track but didn't loft with conviction, he feared the worst as soon as he hit it, Thisara takes it well in front of the rope

after two drops someone finally hangs on! What a freakish over this has been. Tossed up by Dilshan and inviting another drive, this was uppish again but Senanayake times his dive well at extra cover and takes the catch
Dilshan never too far from the spotlight today, it's a length ball outside off, Philander goes back looking to cut, thick edge and Sangakkara knew it, Dilshanset off with the airplane celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Malinga 4 (6b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: he comes round the wicket and the ploy works straightaway! Bowled from slightly wide of the crease and he got it to angle back in sharply and de Kock was playing down the wrong line, hits the leg stump

dismissalComment.html: that's another failure for Kallis! The sharp bouncer leads to his downfall, Malinga reverts to over the wicket for Kallis, bangs it in short and Kallis can't resist the hook, there was a sound and Sangakkara threw the ball up as soon as he caught it, it was a good catch too

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Sangakkara b Mendis 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka get back in this with two in quick succession, Duminy this time perishing for playing the cut, this was the off break that was drifting wide of the left-hander, he chased it and Sangakkara takes the thick edge

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Senanayake b Dilshan 4 (8b 1x4 0x6 8m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: after two drops someone finally hangs on! What a freakish over this has been. Tossed up by Dilshan and inviting another drive, this was uppish again but Senanayake times his dive well at extra cover and takes the catch

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren c Kulasekara b Senanayake 3 (17b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 17.64

dismissalComment.html: the pressure of four dot balls prompts this release shot and it is a very soft dismissal in the end, he tossed it up a bit more and gave him a bit more width, McLaren was looking at lofting it straighter and got a leading edge that lobbed to Kulasekara at point

dismissalText.commentary: Vernon Philander c Sangakkara b Dilshan 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan never too far from the spotlight today, it's a length ball outside off, Philander goes back looking to cut, thick edge and Sangakkara knew it, Dilshanset off with the airplane celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Senanayake b Malinga 101 (102b 11x4 0x6 162m) SR: 99.01

dismissalComment.html: it's a full toss and Amla has holed out! On the body and he looks to swing it over the infield but a very easy catch for Senanayake at midwicket, they check if the ball was above waist height but it was within the limit

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: another yorker but this time Morkel couldn't keep it out, it was in fact the slower ball, Morkel played all around it and the ball struck the off stump

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn lbw b Mendis 23 (35b 4x4 0x6 53m) SR: 65.71

dismissalComment.html: Steyn's been given out lbw and Steyn is reviewing it, it was the googly, Steyn was trapped on the back foot, the ball hits the top flap of the pad first and then the bat, height was the doubt and Hawkeye shows the ball hitting the top of the off stump, umpire's call stands, Steyn's gone and that's the match

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn lbw b Mendis 23 (35b 4x4 0x6 53m) SR: 65.71

commentTextItems.html: Steyn's been given out lbw and Steyn is reviewing it, it was the googly, Steyn was trapped on the back foot, the ball hits the top flap of the pad first and then the bat, height was the doubt and Hawkeye shows the ball hitting the top of the off stump, umpire's call stands, Steyn's gone and that's the match

commentPostTextItems.html: AB de Villiers: "Thought we started really slowly with the ball. Still in with a chance. We pulled it back to 260 from 300 and above. Hash played an amazing innings and not enough partnerships around him. I got out to a soft dismissal. Dale showed that if you spent enough time you could do. I got out but there are other batsmen too."

Dilshan is the Man of the Match: "I'm really enjoying playing here in Pallekele. I got the message that 260-270 was a good total. It turned later in the evening. Not easy to bowl with the new rules. But I'm enjoying it. I have returned from Tests and I am focusing on the next World Cup now."

Mathews: "I was a bit concerned after we collapsed, thought 30-40 runs short. Dilshan played a great knock. All spinners contributed. We knew the South Africans were coming hard at us. Looking forward to the third game."
That's it from us here. Thanks for your company. Argentina v Netherlands coming up. And after that, on Saturday, is the decider at Hambantota. It's a day game. We will see you then. Goodbye!

End of match: Sri Lanka keep the series alive going into the third game. The game was slipping away until AB de Villiers played that shot. He ducked his head as soon as the ball dipped towards the long-on fielder. Nobody knew it at that point but Sri Lanka were given an escape route and only Amla stood in their way. Their spinners brought them back but Amla's dismissal all but confirmed the win.

Some records still stand - SA are yet to beat SL in two consecutive matches in their backyard and they are yet to beat them in an ODI when set 250 or above. On the 13 occasions before this one when Amla has scored an ODI century, South Africa have emerged victorious. Until tonight.
The choice for the Man of the Match should be unanimous. Dilshan stood out with bat and ball yet again. Presentation coming up.
Mazher Arshad: "Tillakaratne Dilshan in 11 ODIs at Pallekele has 768 runs at an average of 96.00 and 9 wickets at average 16.66."

commentTextItems.html: this time he keeps it out to the off side

another yorker and there's a big shout for the lbw and he was not given, they review it, bizarrely the ball went under the bat, spun back in and hit the pads, not in front of the stumps though so he is safe

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: another yorker but this time Morkel couldn't keep it out, it was in fact the slower ball, Morkel played all around it and the ball struck the off stump

commentPostTextItems.html: Rohit Yadav: "Amla's weakness sorted out, It's 'full-toss'.. :)"

commentTextItems.html: he gets a yorker and he digs it out back to the bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Senanayake b Malinga 101 (102b 11x4 0x6 162m) SR: 99.01

commentTextItems.html: it's a full toss and Amla has holed out! On the body and he looks to swing it over the infield but a very easy catch for Senanayake at midwicket, they check if the ball was above waist height but it was within the limit

commentPreTextItems.html: Twitchy little period for SL. Malinga pulls back before delivery. Not sure why

commentTextItems.html: it's a full toss and he swings and mistimes it wide of mid-on who dives but doesn't take the single
full on the stumps and defended
round the wicket and yet another wide down leg
South Africa are not giving up! Tossed up and Steyn gives the charge and lofts him over extra cover, making use of the powerplay
gets forward and pushes it to the off side
makes the same mistake again, too wide down leg
poor ball as he strays down the leg side
he comes down the track, wants to hit it straight and he gets an outside edge that clears point, nobody there
tossed up and he comes forward and defends
in the air and drops short! Strange shot, he brings out the slog and it's a top edge that drops short of deep square running in
it's a low full toss on the pads and he reaches his century! He also keeps the strike, single to deep square, no major celebrations because his team has its back to the wall, century under pressure

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: the ball stops on him a bit and he stabs it to mid-off
that was a classic shot! Length ball on the middle stump, he punches it over mid-on, knew the fielder was up and the follow through was great too
he strays down the leg side and wide called

tossed up and Jayawardene had made room to scoop it over the off side but he didn't read the googly and the ball crashed middle and leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Amla b Philander 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: that was a very soft dismissal! This was drifting on the pads and Kusal shuffled and looked to tuck it to the on side, too early on the shot and the ball lobbed tamely to short midwicket, you could have caught that with your eyes shut

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c de Kock b Morkel 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: caught down the leg side and that's the big wicket, Morkel dug it in short down the leg side and Sangakkara was looking to pull, the ball got high on him and the ball brushed his glove first, he walked

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Amla b Imran Tahir 36 (49b 4x4 0x6 56m) SR: 73.46

dismissalComment.html: Tahir gets away with a short one and Thirimanne had only himself to blame here, it was asking to be hit over the on side but the batsman got the placement all wrong, Amla was at deep midwicket and he didn't have to move much, bends and takes it comfortably

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Duminy 86 (90b 9x4 0x6 136m) SR: 95.55

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan's out bowled but somehow he's not convinced, Duminy was bowling from round the wicket, Dilshan was looking to sweep, the ball struck the off bail, Dilshan didn't really see how he was bowled and hung around for a few seconds, the ball deflected off the glove to the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Imran Tahir 48 (70b 1x4 0x6 88m) SR: 68.57

dismissalComment.html: tossed up and Jayawardene had made room to scoop it over the off side but he didn't read the googly and the ball crashed middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c de Kock b McLaren 34 (38b 1x4 1x6 70m) SR: 89.47

dismissalComment.html: that was more a Test match dismissal, McLaren bowled it on the corridor of uncertainty, Mathews was cramped for room, feet not moving and thick outside edge to the keeper, the sort of dismissal on the first morning of a Test with the new ball

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c de Villiers b McLaren 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Kulasekara stayed at the crease and looked to smash it just about anywhere, nowhere near the pitch of it and he got a top edge that swirled to the off side, de Villiers takes the skier

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan c Duminy b McLaren 25 (15b 2x4 1x6 24m) SR: 166.66

dismissalComment.html: the third for the over! This was the short ball and slower as well, Priyanjan had crossed the previous ball and took strike but he too fell to a top edge, swung too early and an easy one for AB running forward from mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c de Kock b McLaren 2 (6b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: the short one was too good for Mendis, Mendis was down the track and he hung out the periscope after realising that he couldn't hook it, feathers the edge and de Kock appeals

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c Morkel b Philander 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: So Sri Lanka don't last 50 overs after all, this was a fuller delivery and Malinga was looking to clear the rope down the ground, he picked long-on and SL have lost 5 wickets for 11 runs

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Senanayake b Malinga 101 (102b 11x4 0x6 162m) SR: 99.01

dismissalComment.html: it's a full toss and Amla has holed out! On the body and he looks to swing it over the infield but a very easy catch for Senanayake at midwicket, they check if the ball was above waist height but it was within the limit

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Malinga 4 (6b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: he comes round the wicket and the ploy works straightaway! Bowled from slightly wide of the crease and he got it to angle back in sharply and de Kock was playing down the wrong line, hits the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c Sangakkara b Malinga 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: that's another failure for Kallis! The sharp bouncer leads to his downfall, Malinga reverts to over the wicket for Kallis, bangs it in short and Kallis can't resist the hook, there was a sound and Sangakkara threw the ball up as soon as he caught it, it was a good catch too

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c sub (NLTC Perera) b Dilshan 29 (41b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 70.73

dismissalComment.html: huge relief for Sri Lanka as AB finds long-on with precision, it was flighted and AB was down the track but didn't loft with conviction, he feared the worst as soon as he hit it, Thisara takes it well in front of the rope

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Sangakkara b Mendis 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka get back in this with two in quick succession, Duminy this time perishing for playing the cut, this was the off break that was drifting wide of the left-hander, he chased it and Sangakkara takes the thick edge

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Senanayake b Dilshan 4 (8b 1x4 0x6 8m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: after two drops someone finally hangs on! What a freakish over this has been. Tossed up by Dilshan and inviting another drive, this was uppish again but Senanayake times his dive well at extra cover and takes the catch

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren c Kulasekara b Senanayake 3 (17b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 17.64

dismissalComment.html: the pressure of four dot balls prompts this release shot and it is a very soft dismissal in the end, he tossed it up a bit more and gave him a bit more width, McLaren was looking at lofting it straighter and got a leading edge that lobbed to Kulasekara at point

dismissalText.commentary: Vernon Philander c Sangakkara b Dilshan 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan never too far from the spotlight today, it's a length ball outside off, Philander goes back looking to cut, thick edge and Sangakkara knew it, Dilshanset off with the airplane celebration

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn lbw b Mendis 23 (35b 4x4 0x6 53m) SR: 65.71

dismissalComment.html: Steyn's been given out lbw and Steyn is reviewing it, it was the googly, Steyn was trapped on the back foot, the ball hits the top flap of the pad first and then the bat, height was the doubt and Hawkeye shows the ball hitting the top of the off stump, umpire's call stands, Steyn's gone and that's the match

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: another yorker but this time Morkel couldn't keep it out, it was in fact the slower ball, Morkel played all around it and the ball struck the off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir not out 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he comes round the wicket and the ploy works straightaway! Bowled from slightly wide of the crease and he got it to angle back in sharply and de Kock was playing down the wrong line, hits the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's another failure for Kallis! The sharp bouncer leads to his downfall, Malinga reverts to over the wicket for Kallis, bangs it in short and Kallis can't resist the hook, there was a sound and Sangakkara threw the ball up as soon as he caught it, it was a good catch too

it's a full toss and Amla has holed out! On the body and he looks to swing it over the infield but a very easy catch for Senanayake at midwicket, they check if the ball was above waist height but it was within the limit
another yorker but this time Morkel couldn't keep it out, it was in fact the slower ball, Morkel played all around it and the ball struck the off stump

headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 66 runs, 2 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 6.4 overs (41 balls), Extras 1
TM Dilshan: 50 off 40 balls (8 x 4)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 90/2 in 15.0 overs (TM Dilshan 58, HDRL Thirimanne 15)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 17.4 overs (107 balls), Extras 4
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 73 balls (TM Dilshan 21, HDRL Thirimanne 26, Ex 3)
Over 26.5: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - DPMD Jayawardene (Upheld)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 29.3 overs (179 balls), Extras 5
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 33 runs, 0 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 39.2 overs (238 balls), Extras 9
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 54 balls (DPMD Jayawardene 23, AD Mathews 23, Ex 4)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 45.4 overs (276 balls), Extras 12
Rain: Sri Lanka - 257/8 in 47.1 overs (SMSM Senanayake 1, BAW Mendis 0)
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 267/10 in 49.2 overs (SMSM Senanayake 9)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 51 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 50 runs in 9.5 overs (59 balls), Extras 1
HM Amla: 50 off 51 balls (8 x 4)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 63 balls (HM Amla 32, AB de Villiers 18, Ex 0)
Drinks: South Africa - 90/2 in 17.0 overs (HM Amla 58, AB de Villiers 26)
South Africa: 100 runs in 18.4 overs (112 balls), Extras 1
South Africa: 150 runs in 32.6 overs (198 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: South Africa - 160/7 in 35.0 overs (HM Amla 93, DW Steyn 15)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 20 runs, 3 wickets)
HM Amla: 100 off 99 balls (11 x 4)
8th Wicket: 50 runs in 53 balls (HM Amla 19, DW Steyn 23, Ex 10)
Over 37.5: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - Imran Tahir (Struck down)
Over 38.1: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - DW Steyn (Struck down)

stories.title: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Pellekele

stories.title: Dilshan soars at favoured venue
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Tillakaratne Dilshan soars at favoured venue
stories.summary: Perhaps it is the cooler mountain air or the smell of rain - whatever the difference, Tillakaratne Dilshan can't get enough of Pallekele

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan is overjoyed after taking the wicket of AB de Villiers
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan is overjoyed after taking the wicket of AB de Villiers, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, July 9, 2014

stories.title: De Villiers bemoans South Africa's inconsistency
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: De Villiers bemoans South Africa's inconsistency
stories.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers bemoaned his team's inconsistent performance in Pallekele that paved the way for an 87-run defeat

image.caption: Sri Lanka celebrate the fall of David Miller
image.longCaption: Sri Lanka celebrate the fall of David Miller, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, July 9, 2014

stories.title: South Africa face the Kallis question
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: South Africa face the Kallis question
stories.summary: Accommodation for a great player like Jacques Kallis should be made with careful consideration and South Africa cannot get carried away with sentiment

image.caption: Jacques Kallis at training on the eve of the second ODI
image.longCaption: Jacques Kallis at training on the eve of the second ODI, Pallekele, July 8, 2014

stories.title: Jayawardene's missing four

stories.title: All-round Dilshan overpowers South Africa
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: All-round Tillakaratne Dilshan overpowers South Africa
stories.summary: A defiant century from Hashim Amla was not enough for South Africa as Tillakaratne Dilshan took Sri Lanka to a competitive total and helped defend it by causing a mini collapse in the middle order

image.caption: Hashim Amla targets the leg side
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla targets the leg side, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, July 9, 2014

stories.title: McLaren becoming vital to SA's ODI plans
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: McLaren becoming vital to SA's ODI plans
stories.summary: David Miller and Ryan McLaren, key men in South Africa's middle order, hope to take the series in the second ODI in Pallekele

image.caption: Ryan McLaren dives to take a catch during training
image.longCaption: Ryan McLaren dives to take a catch during training, Centurion, February 10, 2014

stories.title: Mathews rules out reshuffling batting order
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Angelo Mathews rules out reshuffling batting order
stories.summary: One-nil down in a home series, Angelo Mathews deflected suggestions that changes could improve his team's chances

image.caption: Angelo Mathews dropped a chance off AB de Villiers
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews dropped a chance off AB de Villiers, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele

stories.summary: Sri Lanka's middle order will come under the scanner in a match they must win to keep the series alive

image.caption: Jacques Kallis at training on the eve of the second ODI
image.longCaption: Jacques Kallis at training on the eve of the second ODI, Pallekele, July 8, 2014

stories.title: Jayawardene's missing four
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the second ODI between Sri Lanka and South Africa in Pallekele

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan is overjoyed after taking the wicket of AB de Villiers
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan is overjoyed after taking the wicket of AB de Villiers, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, July 9, 2014

videos.title: 260-odd was chaseable - de Villiers
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
videos.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers says even though 268 was not easy to chase on the Pallekele pitch, they should have beaten Sri Lanka, especially with Hashim Amla's hundred

videos.title: Expect a slow and turning pitch - Miller
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
videos.seoTitle: Expect a slow and turning pitch - David Miller
videos.summary: South Africa batsman David Miller talks about the kind of pitch he expects in Pallekele for the second ODI after a high-scoring match in Colombo

recentReportStory.title: All-round Dilshan overpowers South Africa
recentReportStory.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
recentReportStory.seoTitle: All-round Tillakaratne Dilshan overpowers South Africa
recentReportStory.summary: A defiant century from Hashim Amla was not enough for South Africa as Tillakaratne Dilshan took Sri Lanka to a competitive total and helped defend it by causing a mini collapse in the middle order

image.caption: Hashim Amla targets the leg side
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla targets the leg side, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele, July 9, 2014

recentReportStory.credit: Firdose Moonda is ESPNcricinfo's South Africa correspondent

recentPreviewStory.title: Series at stake for jolted hosts
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Pallekele
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Series at stake for jolted hosts
recentPreviewStory.summary: Sri Lanka's middle order will come under the scanner in a match they must win to keep the series alive
recentPreviewStory.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan during a training session
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan during a training session, Chittagong, March 21, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Andrew Fidel Fernando is ESPNcricinfo's Sri Lanka correspondent. @andrewffernando
